isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE (with R-134a Refrigerant System) - DESCRIPTION OF SYSTEM COMPONENTS - HIGH PRESSURE SWITCH

svcproc.title: HIGH PRESSURE SWITCH

figure.caption: Figure 19. High Pressure Switch (Mounted on Expansion Valve)

svcproc.para: A high pressure switch has been added to air conditioning systems to prevent exhausting refrigerant into the atmosphere under high pressure conditions. When abnormally high pressures are reached, the high pressure switch will disengage the A/C clutch before the pressure relief valve opens. The high pressure switch is typically located on the expansion valve. If necessary, refer to the air conditioning service section for the vehicle being serviced for the location of the switch. Refer to SPECIFICATIONS for the opening pressures of this switch.
